title: Personal Portfolio
tagline: The responsive, data-driven site you are viewing right now
desc: A modern portfolio website built with Flask. Features a JSON-driven content architecture for easy updates, a custom AJAX contact form with toast notifications, and a polished glassmorphism UI design.
highlights: Data-Driven Architecture: Content managed via JSON files, separating data from logic
AJAX Contact System: Asynchronous form submission with custom toast alerts
Modern UX: Responsive glassmorphism design with liquid cursor interactions

title: FamilyConnect
tagline: M.Sc. final project — a lightweight social / messaging prototype
desc: FamilyConnect is a prototype social/messaging platform for families to share updates, photos, and short messages in a private feed. Focused on simple posting UX, basic media handling and privacy controls.
highlights: Private, family-oriented feed with image attachments
Simple moderation and user profile management
Server-side image handling and responsive UI

title: Workplace
tagline: M.Sc. mini project — small team workflow & resource hub
desc: Workplace is a compact app to manage tasks, docs and internal announcements for academic project teams. Lightweight, role-aware and built for easy hosting.
highlights: Task and document management tailored for academic teams
Role-based access to protect project resources
Simple, performant backend suitable for shared hosting

title: Departmental Website
tagline: B.Sc. final-year project — a polished departmental portal
desc: A responsive departmental portal for faculty, students and events. CMS-style admin features for announcements, resources and event publishing with accessible markup.
highlights: Responsive multi-page site with faculty, events and resources sections
Admin interface for announcements and event publishing
Accessible markup and mobile-first styling for wide device support

title: Snake Game
desc: A compact Snake game implemented in Python demonstrating event loop, collision detection and scoring — good small project for interactive programming.
highlights: Classic snake mechanics: growth, collision, scoring
Keyboard controls and smooth game loop
Great introduction to Python game development
